intro: Helena purpureocincta, commonly known as the purple-banded helena, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive purple band along the midrib, giving it its common name. Helena purpureocincta thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in rich, well-drained soils.
